result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chris K. CAFLISCH

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Dismiss ordering the action dismissed without prejudice because as part of plea agreement, on 01-28-16, the defendant plead guilty to two counts in 15 TR 3016 (OWI) and 15 TR 3018 and was convicted.  This file was to be dismissed and read in at that time.
Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 12-04-2015 at 2:15 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-21-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 10-12-15 at 2:30 p.m.    
Notice. 
Minutes.
RE:  Possess THC - 2nd or subsequent offense, on 09-06-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess THC - 2nd offense.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-28-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
